summary: The Stump Jump 50k and 10 Miler is a premier trail running event held atop Signal Mountain and Walden Ridge in Tennessee, offering a grueling tour of the Prentice Cooper State Forest. Runners navigate highly technical single-track trails that feature over 5,000 feet of elevation gain and provide breathtaking panoramic views of the Tennessee River Gorge.
uniqueFeatures: Participants must navigate the notoriously technical 'Rock Garden,' a signature section of the course characterized by a dense field of jagged sandstone boulders and roots.
The route passes by unique geological landmarks including the iconic Mushroom Rock, a massive natural sandstone formation located deep within the forest.
The 50k distance features a 'lollipop' course design that requires runners to conquer the most elevation-intensive sections twice, occurring at both the start and the conclusion of the race.

media.title: StumpJump 50k
media.summary: An authoritative overview of the race history, course topology, and record holders, detailing the 'lollipop' shaped course and its technical 'Rock Garden' section.
media.contentSummary: This Wikipedia article provides an overview of the StumpJump 50k ultramarathon in Tennessee, describing its technical course layout, history since 2002, and notable record holders.

media.title: Stump Jump 50K: the ever-inconsistent ‘Beast of the East’
media.summary: An in-depth editorial profile describing the notorious 'Beast of the East' course, including its 'Rock Garden' and the scenic overlooks of the Tennessee River Gorge.
media.contentSummary: Lindsey Shady provides a detailed personal race report of the Stump Jump 50K, describing the technical Chattanooga trails, the iconic suspension bridge, and the grueling Rock Garden section.

media.title: The Team Behind Recover: Ben Prater Takes On The Stump Jump 50k
media.summary: An evergreen profile and interview detailing the race's 6,500 feet of elevation gain and its reputation as a premier Southeast trail event.
media.contentSummary: Ben Prater shares his personal experience and insights from competing in the Stump Jump 50k trail race.
